text: The 2000 UCI Mountain Bike & Trials World Championships were held in Sierra Nevada, Andalusia, Spain from 7 to 11 June 2000. The disciplines included were cross-country, downhill, dual slalom, and trials. The event was the 11th edition of the UCI Mountain Bike World Championships and the 15th edition of the UCI Trials World Championships. ==Medal summary== ===Men's events=== {| |- |Cross-country | | | |- |Under 23 cross-country | | | |- |Junior cross-country | | | |- |Downhill | | | |- |Junior downhill | | | |- |Dual slalom | | | |- |Trials, 20 inch | | | |- |Trials, 26 inch | | | |- |Junior trials, 20 inch | | | |- |Junior trials, 26 inch | | | |} ===Women's events=== {| |- |Cross- country | | | |- |Junior cross-country | | | |- |Downhill | | | |- |Junior downhill | | | |- |Dual slalom | | | |} ===Team events=== {| |- |Cross-country | Roberto Lezaun Margarita Fullana Iñaki Lejarreta Errasti José Antonio Hermida | Christophe Sauser Florian Vogel Barbara Blatter Silvio Bundi | Marco Bui Leonardo Zanotti Mirko Faranisi Paola Pezzoa |- |Trials, 20 inch | | | |- |Trials, 26 inch | | | |} ===Medal table=== ==See also== *2000 UCI Mountain Bike World Cup *UCI Mountain Bike Marathon World Championships ==References== ==External links== * Results for the mountain-bike events on cyclingnews.com * Results for the trials events on uci.ch Category:UCI Mountain Bike World Championships Category:International cycle races hosted by Spain UCI Mountain Bike and Trials World Championships
